DataElement.preferredName: Breast Primary Invasive Adenocarcinoma Histologically Confirmed Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether primary invasive breast adenocarcinoma (a malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization) has been established or verified by the use of histology or histological techniques.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Primary Invasive Adenocarcinoma Histologically Confirmed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to having been established or verified by the use of histology or histological techniques primary invasive breast adenocarcinoma (a malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.:carcinoma derived from glandular tissue or in which tumor cells form recognizable glandular structures.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A common cancer characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells.  Morphologically, adenocarcinomas are classified according to the growth pattern (e.g., papillary, alveolar) or according to the secreting product (e.g., mucinous, serous).  Representative examples of adenocarcinoma are ductal and lobular breast carcinoma, lung adenocarcinoma, renal cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma), colon adenocarcinoma, and prostate adenocarcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.
